author: Nicole Friedman
title: Oil Prices Rally Amid Lower U.S. Output Estimates, OPEC Article
text:
Oil prices turned higher Monday on speculation that oil-producing nations might be willing to agree to output cuts to shrink the global glut of crude oil.
An oversupply of crude oil has sent oil prices plunging to six-year lows in recent months, and many market watchers donâ€™t expect prices to recover until late 2016 or 2017. The U.S. benchmark... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In
